title: Victoria's Secret model Jessica Hart gives advice to those getting into the fashoion industry
text:
She's the former Victoria's Secret model who has spent years on the catwalk.

And this week Jessica Hart passed on her words of wisdom to those wanting to get into the cut-throat modelling industry, during a candid interview with The Daily Telegraph.

The 33-year-old revealed that it was her mum who gave her the most invaluable piece of advice, which she's carried with her throughout her incredible career.

Passing on the baton! On Friday, former Victoria's Secret model Jessica Hart (pictured) revealed the one piece of advice her mother gave her before going into the industry

She revealed: 'My mum said early on, if you're an orange and the client wants an apple, then it doesn't make the orange any less beautiful.

'They just wanted something else that day. That little lesson was great and I've always carried it with me.'

She added that while she never used to be interested in fashion, she's now found it to be 'a form of art'.

Jessica recently opened up about her career in an interview with Harper's Baazar - and explained why she decided to change her lifestyle, and quit drinking for good.

After spending her early modelling years partying all over the world, she explained that drinking had caught up with her.

In June 2019, she marked one year of being sober.

Arty! She added that while she never used to be interested in fashion, she's now found it to be 'a form of art'

She explained to the publication: 'In my late twenties I started to feel, 'This is getting old'. I always knew there was more to me. And to life.'

She added that she believes her body is a temple, and said it was 'time to give back' after 'putting it through so much'.

The model also credited her younger sister Ashley with helping her on her journey to sobriety.

'Ashley was also my guiding light. She has done so much [wellness and spiritual] work on herself and is someone constantly learning to be at one with herself,' she said.
